content.p: Module convenor: Sharon Romeo Department: Faculty of Science and Engineering ‘Global Citizen’ is a module aimed at encouraging students to interact with and learn in depth information about different cultures that they haven’t encountered before. Each student enrolled in this module will select one person belonging to a different country and will interact with them to learn about their culture. They can either pair up with other students taking the module or seek the permission of another student to learn from. A detailed template will be provided to each student that explains what kind of information they are expected to learn. This includes but is not limited to: 1. Geography, climate, population 2. Festivals, food, religion, clothing, arts (music, dance, literature, cinema), language 3. Political system, division of states, current affairs, economy They will then be required to present what they have learnt, and include their personal experience learning about this culture. Grading will be based on how much information is covered and how well it has been presented. Coursework and Presentation Students enrolled on this module must participate in this Introductory Session on 16 Oct 2024, from 6:30 pm - 8:30 pm at F1A22. Registration for this module is now closed.
